refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GParamSpec is an object structure that encapsulates the metadata required to specify parameters, such as e.g. GObject properties.

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_IS_PARAM()
refsect2.para: Returns whether type "is a" G_TYPE_PARAM.

refsect2.title: G_PARAM_SPEC()
refsect2.para: Casts a derived GParamSpec object (e.g. of type GParamSpecInt) into a GParamSpec object.

refsect2.title: G_IS_PARAM_SPEC()
refsect2.para: Checks whether pspec "is a" valid GParamSpec structure of type G_TYPE_PARAM or derived.

refsect2.title: G_PARAM_SPEC_CLASS()
refsect2.para: Casts a derived GParamSpecClass structure into a GParamSpecClass structure.

refsect2.title: G_IS_PARAM_SPEC_CLASS()
refsect2.para: Checks whether pclass "is a" valid GParamSpecClass structure of type G_TYPE_PARAM or derived.

refsect2.title: G_PARAM_SPEC_GET_CLASS()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the GParamSpecClass of a GParamSpec.

refsect2.title: G_PARAM_SPEC_TYPE()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the GType of this pspec.

refsect2.title: G_PARAM_SPEC_TYPE_NAME()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the GType name of this pspec.

refsect2.title: G_PARAM_SPEC_VALUE_TYPE()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the GType to initialize a GValue for this parameter.

refsect2.title: struct GParamSpec
refsect2.para: All fields of the GParamSpec struct are private and should not be used directly, except for the following:

listitem.simpara: the GValue type for this parameter
GType type that uses (introduces) this paremeter

refsect2.title: struct GParamSpecClass
refsect2.para: The class structure for the GParamSpec type. Normally, GParamSpec classes are filled by g_param_type_register_static().

listitem.simpara: the GValue type for this parameter
The instance finalization function (optional), should chain up to the finalize method of the parent class.
Resets a value to the default value for this type (recommended, the default is g_value_reset()), see g_param_value_set_default().
Ensures that the contents of value comply with the specifications set out by this type (optional), see g_param_value_set_validate().
Compares value1 with value2 according to this type (recommended, the default is memcmp()), see g_param_values_cmp().

refsect2.title: enum GParamFlags
refsect2.para: Through the GParamFlags flag values, certain aspects of parameters can be configured.

listitem.simpara: the parameter will be set upon object construction
the parameter will only be set upon object construction
upon parameter conversion (see g_param_value_convert()) strict validation is not required

refsect2.title: G_PARAM_READWRITE
refsect2.para: GParamFlags value alias for G_PARAM_READABLE | G_PARAM_WRITABLE.

refsect2.title: G_PARAM_MASK
refsect2.para: Mask containing the bits of GParamSpec.flags which are reserved for GLib.

refsect2.title: G_PARAM_USER_SHIFT
refsect2.para: Minimum shift count to be used for user defined flags, to be stored in GParamSpec.flags.

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_ref ()
refsect2.para: Increments the reference count of pspec.

listitem.simpara: the GParamSpec that was passed into this function

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_unref ()
refsect2.para: Decrements the reference count of a pspec.

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_sink ()
refsect2.para: The initial reference count of a newly created GParamSpec is 1, even though no one has explicitly called g_param_spec_ref() on it yet. So the initial reference count is flagged as "floating", until someone calls g_param_spec_ref (pspec); g_param_spec_sink (pspec); in sequence on it, taking over the initial reference count (thus ending up with a pspec that has a reference count of 1 still, but is not flagged "floating" anymore).

refsect2.title: g_param_value_set_default ()
refsect2.para: Sets value to its default value as specified in pspec.

listitem.simpara: a GValue of correct type for pspec

refsect2.title: g_param_value_defaults ()
refsect2.para: Checks whether value contains the default value as specified in pspec.

listitem.simpara: a GValue of correct type for pspec
whether value contains the canonical defualt for this pspec

refsect2.title: g_param_value_validate ()
refsect2.para: Ensures that the contents of value comply with the specifications set out by pspec. For example, a GParamSpecInt might require that integers stored in value may not be smaller than -42 and not be greater than +42. If value contains an integer outside of this range, it is modified accordingly, so the resulting value will fit into the range -42 .. +42.

listitem.simpara: a GValue of correct type for pspec
whether modifying value was necessary to ensure validity

refsect2.title: g_param_value_convert ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean g_param_value_convert (GParamSpec *pspec, const GValue *src_value, GValue *dest_value, gboolean strict_validation);
refsect2.para:
Transforms src_value into dest_value if possible, and then validates dest_value, in order for it to conform to pspec. If strict_validation is TRUE this function will only succeed if the transformed dest_value complied to pspec without modifications.
See also g_value_type_transformable(), g_value_transform() and g_param_value_validate().

listitem.simpara: destination GValue of correct type for pspec
TRUE requires dest_value to conform to pspec without modifications
TRUE if transformation and validation were successfull, FALSE otherwise and dest_value is left untouched.

refsect2.title: g_param_values_cmp ()

listitem.simpara: a GValue of correct type for pspec
a GValue of correct type for pspec
-1, 0 or +1, for a less than, equal to or greater than result

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_get_name ()
refsect2.para: Returns the name of a GParamSpec.

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_get_nick ()
refsect2.para: Returns the nickname of a GParamSpec.

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_get_blurb ()
refsect2.para: Returns the short description of a GParamSpec.

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_get_qdata ()
refsect2.para: Gets back user data pointers stored via g_param_spec_set_qdata().

listitem.simpara: a GQuark, naming the user data pointer
the user data pointer set, or NULL

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_set_qdata ()
refsect2.para: Sets an opaque, named pointer on a GParamSpec. The name is specified through a GQuark (retrieved e.g. via g_quark_from_static_string()), and the pointer can be gotten back from the pspec with g_param_spec_get_qdata(). Setting a previously set user data pointer, overrides (frees) the old pointer set, using NULL as pointer essentially removes the data stored.

listitem.simpara: the GParamSpec to set store a user data pointer
a GQuark, naming the user data pointer

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_set_qdata_full ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_param_spec_set_qdata_full (GParamSpec *pspec, GQuark quark, gpointer data, GDestroyNotify destroy);
refsect2.para: This function works like g_param_spec_set_qdata(), but in addition, a void (*destroy) (gpointer) function may be specified which is called with data as argument when the pspec is finalized, or the data is being overwritten by a call to g_param_spec_set_qdata() with the same quark.

listitem.simpara: the GParamSpec to set store a user data pointer
a GQuark, naming the user data pointer
function to invoke with data as argument, when data needs to be freed

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_steal_qdata ()
refsect2.para: Gets back user data pointers stored via g_param_spec_set_qdata() and removes the data from pspec without invoking it's destroy() function (if any was set). Usually, calling this function is only required to update user data pointers with a destroy notifier.

listitem.simpara: the GParamSpec to get a stored user data pointer from
a GQuark, naming the user data pointer
the user data pointer set, or NULL

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_get_redirect_target ()
refsect2.para: If the paramspec redirects operations to another paramspec, returns that paramspec. Redirect is used typically for providing a new implementation of a property in a derived type while perserving all the properties from the parent type. Redirection is established by creating a property of type GParamSpecOverride. See g_object_override_property() for an example of the use of this capability.

listitem.simpara: paramspec to which requests on this paramspec should be redirected, or NULL if none.

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_internal ()
refsect2.programlisting: gpointer g_param_spec_internal (GType param_type, const gchar *name, const gchar *nick, const gchar *blurb, GParamFlags flags);
refsect2.para: Creates a new GParamSpec instance.

A property name consists of segments consisting of ASCII letters and digits, separated by either the '-' or '_' character. The first character of a property name must be a letter. Names which violate these rules lead to undefined behaviour.

When creating and looking up a GParamSpec, either separator can be used, but they cannot be mixed. Using '-' is considerably more efficient and in fact required when using property names as detail strings for signals.

listitem.simpara: the GType for the property; must be derived from G_TYPE_PARAM
the canonical name of the property
a short description of the property

refsect2.title: struct GParamSpecTypeInfo
refsect2.para: This structure is used to provide the type system with the information required to initialize and destruct (finalize) a parameter's class and instances thereof. The initialized structure is passed to the g_param_type_register_static() The type system will perform a deep copy of this structure, so it's memory does not need to be persistent across invocation of g_param_type_register_static().

listitem.simpara: Number of pre-allocated (cached) instances to reserve memory for (0 indicates no caching).
Location of the instance initialization function (optional).
The GType of values conforming to this GParamSpec
Resets a value to the default value for pspec (recommended, the default is g_value_reset()), see g_param_value_set_default().
Ensures that the contents of value comply with the specifications set out by pspec (optional), see g_param_value_set_validate().
Compares value1 with value2 according to pspec (recommended, the default is memcmp()), see g_param_values_cmp().

refsect2.title: g_param_type_register_static ()
refsect2.para: Registers name as the name of a new static type derived from G_TYPE_PARAM. The type system uses the information contained in the GParamSpecTypeInfo structure pointed to by info to manage the GParamSpec type and its instances.

listitem.simpara: 0-terminated string used as the name of the new GParamSpec type.
The GParamSpecTypeInfo for this GParamSpec type.

refsect2.title: struct GParamSpecPool
refsect2.para: A GParamSpecPool maintains a collection of GParamSpecs which can be quickly accessed by owner and name. The implementation of the GObject property system uses such a pool to store the GParamSpecs of the properties all object types.

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_pool_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GParamSpecPool.

If type_prefixing is TRUE, lookups in the newly created pool will allow to specify the owner as a colon-separated prefix of the property name, like "GtkContainer:border-width". This feature is deprecated, so you should always set type_prefixing to FALSE.

listitem.simpara: Whether the pool will support type-prefixed property names.

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_pool_insert ()
refsect2.para: Inserts a GParamSpec in the pool.

listitem.simpara: a GType identifying the owner of pspec

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_pool_remove ()
refsect2.para: Removes a GParamSpec from the pool.

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_pool_lookup ()
refsect2.programlisting: GParamSpec* g_param_spec_pool_lookup (GParamSpecPool *pool, const gchar *param_name, GType owner_type, gboolean walk_ancestors);
refsect2.para: Looks up a GParamSpec in the pool.

listitem.simpara: If TRUE, also try to find a GParamSpec with param_name owned by an ancestor of owner_type.
The found GParamSpec, or NULL if no matching GParamSpec was found.

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_pool_list ()
refsect2.para: Gets an array of all GParamSpecs owned by owner_type in the pool.

listitem.simpara: return location for the length of the returned array
a newly allocated array containing pointers to all GParamSpecs owned by owner_type in the pool

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_pool_list_owned ()
refsect2.para: Gets an GList of all GParamSpecs owned by owner_type in the pool.

listitem.simpara: a GList of all GParamSpecs owned by owner_type in the poolGParamSpecs.
